channel.title: LCROCC blog
channel.description: This Antenna App collection olds the posts for the Left Coast RISC OS Computer Club.

item.title: News from the RISC OS London Show 2025
item.description: A quick summary have what Steven Revill's talk indicated as goals for the upcoming RISC OS 5.32 release in 2026.
item.source:markdown:
# News from the RISC OS London Show 2025
You can find Leo White's coverage of the RISC OS London Show 2025 on [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLdbtoCQ_z-HFgLf7GUliPGIX5CNSTk97B). The talk I find very informative was Steve Revill's [talk](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wyp5tvEoOaw&list=PLdbtoCQ_z-HFgLf7GUliPGIX5CNSTk97B&index=3) outlining what RISC Open Ltd is up time, the work done on BBC Basic implemented in C and importantly what maybe coming next year in the upcoming stable RISC OS 5.32 release planned for 2026.
The Highlights for goals RISC OS 5.32 include
- New user setup wizard (goal to make it easier to for people new to RISC OS) - Updated Paint - BASIC rewritten in C - Iconbar flip (configurable in the setup wizard) - this would allow flip where drives versus applications are show - makes a little more similar to other OS taskbar layouts - Light and Dark themes - Password reveal button for password prompts
